questions.prompt: Which muscle type is voluntary and most directly targeted by typical massage techniques?
questions.why: Skeletal muscle is voluntary and is the primary contractile tissue manipulated in most massage sessions.
questions.trap: Smooth muscle is involuntary and found in organs and vessels.
questions.hook: Massage mainly works with skeletal muscle.

questions.prompt: A muscles ability to respond to a stimulus (like a nerve signal) is called:
questions.why: Excitability is the capacity to respond to stimulation.
questions.trap: Contractility is the ability to shorten and produce force.

questions.prompt: Which property describes a muscles ability to be stretched without being damaged?
questions.why: Extensibility is the ability to be stretched.
questions.trap: Elasticity is the ability to return to original length after stretching.

questions.prompt: Indirect muscle attachment to bone occurs when connective tissue extends beyond the muscle to form a:
questions.why: Tendons are collagen-rich extensions that connect muscle to bone.
questions.trap: Ligaments connect bone-to-bone.

questions.prompt: A single muscle cell is best described as a:
questions.why: A muscle fiber is one muscle cell; fascicles are bundles of fibers.
questions.trap: Myofilaments are inside the fiber.

questions.prompt: A fascicle is:
questions.why: Fascicles group multiple fibers together within a muscle.
questions.trap: Myofibrils are inside fibers; fascicles contain fibers.

questions.prompt: A motor unit is:

choices.B: One neuron and all muscle fibers it stimulates

questions.answer: One neuron and all muscle fibers it stimulates.
questions.why: Motor units are recruited to increase force output.
questions.trap: Fascicles are structural bundles, not nerve relationships.

questions.prompt: During skeletal muscle contraction, the sarcoplasmic reticulum releases:
questions.why: Calcium enables the contraction machinery to engage.
questions.trap: Acetylcholine is released at the neuromuscular junction, not from the SR.

questions.prompt: A single, brief contraction of a muscle fiber is called a:
questions.why: A twitch is one brief contraction-relaxation cycle.
questions.trap: Tetanus is sustained contraction.

questions.prompt: Rapid contractions with partial relaxation between them is called:
questions.why: The muscle cant fully relax, so force builds.
questions.trap: Complete tetanus has no relaxation.

questions.prompt: Complete tetanus means:
questions.why: Stimuli arrive so quickly that the muscle stays fully contracted.
questions.trap: Partial relaxation = incomplete tetanus.

questions.prompt: Treppe (staircase phenomenon) describes:

choices.A: Each contraction becomes stronger when repeated with rests

questions.answer: Each contraction becomes stronger when repeated with rests.
questions.why: Repeated stimulation can produce a staircase increase in force.
questions.trap: No relaxation is tetanus, not treppe.

questions.prompt: Isometric contraction means the muscle:
questions.why: Isometric = tension without visible movement/length change.
questions.trap: Isotonic includes movement.

questions.prompt: Eccentric contraction means the muscle:
questions.why: Eccentric = controlled lengthening under load (often associated with soreness).
questions.trap: Concentric is shortening under load.

questions.prompt: Concentric contraction means the muscle:
questions.why: Concentric contractions shorten the muscle to create movement.
questions.trap: Isometric is force with no length change.

questions.prompt: At rest, muscles obtain most energy by metabolizing:
questions.why: Resting muscle relies heavily on fatty acids; CP is more for early activity bursts.
questions.trap: Lactic acid is a byproduct, not a primary fuel source.

questions.prompt: Elasticity means:

choices.A: Ability to shorten and generate force
choices.B: Ability to return to original length after stretching

questions.why: Elasticity is recoil after stretch.
questions.trap: Extensibility is ability to stretch.

questions.prompt: Threshold refers to:

choices.A: Minimum stimulus needed to trigger contraction

questions.why: Threshold = minimum to initiate a response.
questions.trap: Twitch is the brief contraction.

questions.prompt: Motor unit means:

choices.C: A neuron and the fibers it controls

questions.answer: A neuron and the fibers it controls.
questions.why: Recruiting motor units increases force.
questions.trap: Fascicle is structural, not neural.

questions.prompt: A single skeletal muscle cell is called a muscle ________.
questions.why: A muscle fiber is one cell.
questions.trap: A fascicle is a bundle of fibers.

questions.prompt: The sarcoplasmic reticulum releases ________ to initiate contraction.
questions.why: Calcium enables contraction machinery.
questions.trap: ACh is the neurotransmitter at the NMJ.

questions.prompt: A neuron and all the fibers it stimulates is called a motor ________.
questions.why: Motor unit = neuron + fibers.
questions.trap: Fascicle is only a fiber bundle.
